alert.note: Alert for Ouray (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 5:04PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Colorado, including the following county, Ouray. * WHEN...Until 815 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 504 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.3 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cow Creek, Cutler Creek, Dry Creek, Courthouse Creek, Coal Creek and Beaver Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of East Central Ouray County between Ridgway and Ouray.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
